# Arpeggio: Dominant 7#5 in A

## Brief Presentation of Arpeggio

The dominant 7#5 arpeggio in A is a musical construct derived from the A dominant 7#5 chord. It consists of the notes A, C#, E, and G. This arpeggio adds color and tension to musical pieces due to the augmented fifth (C#) compared to a standard dominant 7 arpeggio.

## Breakdown of Notes and Intervals

- A (Root)
- C# (Major 3rd)
- E (Augmented 5th)
- G (Minor 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor

This arpeggio is often used in jazz, fusion, and progressive rock genres to create a sense of tension and dissonance. The augmented 5th provides a unique and edgy sound that can be both jarring and captivating to the listener. When used in improvisation, it can add a sense of unpredictability and excitement to the music.
